channel.title: Rs2scape
channel.description:
woooooooooooooooooo im back with another development that I probably won't finish!
of course le git for you critiques who want to follow my progress: https://github.com/lare96/Rs2scape
[u][b]Introduction[/b][/u]
Pretty much [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,625797.msg4258434.html]since the last pile of shit I released[/url] (god that framework is fuc[b][/b]king horrible don't use it) I've been reading up on NIO and trying to understand the fundamentals of concurrency better. After creating countless half-completed NIO frameworks I'm almost positive I have this crap written on the walls of my brain.
[u][b]Purpose[/b][/u]
To create [b]simple[/b] and [b]straightforward[/b] framework that people who aren't geniuses can understand. I hate seeing shit like [i]AsynchronousAbstractSelectorEngineDecoder[/i] when it literally could have been named something more practical that would define its purpose better. The only thing worse than that is seeing almost useless over-complicated code that could be written [i]so[/i] much simpler. Then you guys wonder why no one wants to use your frameworks? What are you trying to achieve? With rs2scape I can assure you once again that everything is simple and straight to the point. People with a decent amount of java and protocol knowledge should be able to understand this relatively well.
[u][b]Design[/b][/u]
In the simplest terms this is pretty much a multithreaded asynchronous nio framework.
The [u][i]GameEngine[/i][/u] is the "control center" if you will which contains methods to start/shutdown the server and gives access to the [i]IoEventSelector[/i], [i]TaskDispatcher[/i], and the [i]World[/i]. It also runs the game logic thread which polls queued i/o events, fires tasks, and then updates entities every tick.
The [u][i]IoEventSelector[/i][/u] (or in other words the [i]reactor[/i]) runs on its own dedicated thread and basically queues i/o events for clients (since you cannot handle any game logic on the networking thread or you'll run into weird state errors and race conditions) that need them (accept, read, write).
The [i][u]TaskDispatcher[/u][/i] runs on the game logic thread and fires previously submitted tasks when the delay is up.
The [i][u]World[/u][/i] handles all in-game entities.
I don't really have any plans (yet) on how I'm going to do entity updating and all of that ish, when I get an idea of how I'm doing it I'll update this topic.
[b][u]Pictures[/u][/b]
oh yes, I'll show you some beautiful pictures of the deob I'm using and my package layout in eclipse :)
but no seriously I'll put up some pictures when I can actually login lol

item.title: Rs2scape
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

made some updates

  • finished the reactor along with queuing the events over to be executed
  • polling and execution of the queued events
  • used “less singleton”
  • started on a task system
  • finished the client request i/o event

what’s next

  • the buffer (might just use someone elses)
  • the task system completed
  • basic login

Read full topic

item.title: Rs2scape
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

sinisoul:

Less singletons

There is nothing wrong with them in this case. Although I would agree that singletons shouldn’t be used as a standalone pattern, rather couple it with the factory pattern.

Jason, it looks good so far. However you should look into NIO.2 which was released in JDK update 7.

Read full topic

item.title: Rs2scape
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

woooooooooooooooooo im back with another development that I probably won’t finish!

of course le git for you critiques who want to follow my progress: https://github.com/lare96/Rs2scape

Introduction

Pretty much since the last pile of shit I released (god that framework is fucking horrible don’t use it) I’ve been reading up on NIO and trying to understand the fundamentals of concurrency better. After creating countless half-completed NIO frameworks I’m almost positive I have this crap written on the walls of my brain.

Purpose

To create simple and straightforward framework that people who aren’t geniuses can understand. I hate seeing shit like AsynchronousAbstractSelectorEngineDecoder when it literally could have been named something more practical that would define its purpose better. The only thing worse than that is seeing almost useless over-complicated code that could be written so much simpler. Then you guys wonder why no one wants to use your frameworks? What are you trying to achieve? With rs2scape I can assure you once again that everything is simple and straight to the point. People with a decent amount of java and protocol knowledge should be able to understand this relatively well.

Design

In the simplest terms this is pretty much a multithreaded asynchronous nio framework.

The GameEngine is the “control center” if you will which contains methods to start/shutdown the server and gives access to the IoEventSelector, TaskDispatcher, and the World. It also runs the game logic thread which polls queued i/o events, fires tasks, and then updates entities every tick.

The IoEventSelector (or in other words the reactor) runs on its own dedicated thread and basically queues i/o events for clients (since you cannot handle any game logic on the networking thread or you’ll run into weird state errors and race conditions) that need them (accept, read, write).

The TaskDispatcher runs on the game logic thread and fires previously submitted tasks when the delay is up.

The World handles all in-game entities.

I don’t really have any plans (yet) on how I’m going to do entity updating and all of that ish, when I get an idea of how I’m doing it I’ll update this topic.

Pictures

oh yes, I’ll show you some beautiful pictures of the deob I’m using and my package layout in eclipse

but no seriously I’ll put up some pictures when I can actually login lol
